name: D. Jellyfish and Mex
statement:
You are given an array of n nonnegative integers a_1, a_2,
dots, a_n. Let m be a variable that is initialized to 0, Jellyfish will
perform the following operation n times: select an index i (1
leq i
leq |a|) and delete a_i from a. add
operatorname{MEX}(a)^{
dagger} to m. Now Jellyfish wants to know the minimum possible final
value of m if he performs all the operations optimally.^{
dagger} The MEX (minimum excluded) of an array is the smallest
non-negative integer that does not belong to the array. For instance:
The MEX of [2,2,1] is 0, because 0 does not belong to the array. The MEX
of [3,1,0,1] is 2, because 0 and 1 belong to the array, but 2 does not.
The MEX of [0,3,1,2] is 4 because 0, 1, 2, and 3 belong to the array,
but 4 does not.
